summary: This is an email chain from June 24, 2008, regarding the Jeffrey Epstein case. It indicates that the Deputy Attorney General has completed a review and determined federal prosecution is appropriate, giving Epstein until June 30, 2008, to comply with a modified plea agreement, including pleading guilty, being sentenced, and surrendering to begin imprisonment.

events.title: Modification of Epstein Agreement
events.description: The U.S. Attorney sent a letter modifying the agreement between the United States and Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Deadline for Epstein's Compliance
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein has until the close of business on this date to comply with the modified plea agreement, including entering a guilty plea, being sentenced, and surrendering to begin imprisonment.

keyFacts: The Deputy Attorney General completed a review and determined federal prosecution of Jeffrey Epstein was appropriate as of June 2008.
Epstein was given a deadline of June 30, 2008, to comply with a modified plea agreement to avoid federal prosecution.
The required compliance included entering a guilty plea, being sentenced, and surrendering to begin a prison sentence.
The agreement had been previously modified by a U.S. Attorney's letter dated December 19, 2007 (or possibly 2006, inferred as prior year).
The communication shows high-level legal coordination regarding Epstein's plea deal between private attorneys (Roy Black, Jack Goldberger, Jay Lefkowitz) and a government official (Jeff Sloman).
